oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Policy Challenges to Governing Learner Appropriate Online Class Sizes in Higher Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Irby, Beverly J.
Torres, Mario
Lara-Alecio, Rafael
Tong, Fuhui
Tabron, Lolita
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of the more intriguing policy developments in education today is the expansion of blended and fully online course delivery. Often at the behest of lawmakers and lobbyists, many colleges and universities are devoting massive resources in support. It is fast becoming a prominent feature in many institutions. To be sure, research over online programming and how it impacts student learning is ongoing. One key aspect to online learning is class size.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Education Leadership Research Center, Texas A&M University
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Education Law and Policy Briefs Journal; Vol. 1 (2017)
